column1: wide outside off stump, Imam lets it go safely by
similar line and length, cut away to third man, and Imam is up and running
less room this time. Short and straighter, but Fakhar shoulders arms
sliced away to the offside. Looked too close to cut, and there was no timing, but surprising misfield in the covers lets the ball squirt through to the boundary. Morgan the man who misfielded
driven to mid-off
slashed away by Zaman. Got just a bit more room, fuller delivery angling away from the left-hander, and a slice gets it just wide of the man at point.
immediate threat from Archer. Straighter, squared Imam up, an outside edge trickles through to third man
too straight, almost legsid-ish, and Fakhar flicks it off the hips to the fine leg boundary. This is a good start for Pakistan
shorter and wider, left alone this time
beautiful bowling. Good length, at pace and swinging away from Imam's outside edge
beats the inside edge this time. Bit of swing for Archer. This has been a challenging over
wide ball prompts a rash swing from Fakhar. Bat nowhere near ball. Better over from England
on a length but wide of off stump, left alone.
similar length and Imam locks to the offside. No swing for Woakes at all
slightly straighter and quicker from Woakes, defended
attempted drive on the up and nearly cost him his wicket. Missed the line of the fuller ball, perhaps too far away for a straight drive. Whizzes past the outside edge
attempts to cut away and beaten again.
excellent over from Woakes. Ball might not do much for him but he's ensuring Imam isn't allowed to get away like Fakhar was the previous over. England coming back after a sloppy first ten balls or so
movement for Archer, but it's short enough for Fakhar to let go
whipped off his pads, this is the ball Fakhar dreams of receiving. Good length on his pads, and Fakhar swivels and dispatches to the midwicket boundary.
kept low, and Fakhar lets it go through, but a misfield from the keeper allows them to steal a bye
has that short stuff finally begun? Shortest ball of the innings, and Imam ducks hastily
defended to the offside
tapped to the onside, and Imam keeps the strike
driven nicely on the up, but straight to the man at mid-off
defended back to the bowler
disdainfully struck over long on for six. I suspect he might not do that to Archer, but charges Woakes, picks up a ball pitched on a length and absolutely biffs it above the long-on boundary
edged away to third man, just the place from where the fielder was taken away. Pakistan looking to pick up the pace now
tucked away to fine leg
Fakhar plays outside the line of the ball. No damage, though, as it ,misses the inside edge and goes through.
glanced down to fine leg, but a leg slip placed presumably specifically for that shot prevents it from going for four.
you think you're fast and short? Fakhar doesn't care. Plants the front foot and creams it to square leg for four
fuller, Fakhar slightly messed up his footwork but defended to cover
swings for the fences again, but a connection was never on the cards
well bowled, and fast. 88 mph, short and popped up off the top of Fakhar's bat, might have been the glove. Balloons over the slips and goes through to third man
defended to the onside
that's a gimme from Woakes, that's poor bowling. Short and wide, and the easiest shot Fakhar's had to play all innings. Stayed inside the line and cracked it through the covers.
got down on one knee and scooped over fine leg! It's not the type of shot you expect him to play, but the good length delivery was perfect for that shot. Woakes is taking a but of a pounding here.
short, pulled away to square leg again, but deft fielding from Bairstow mean they only get one.
flicked off the pads to fine leg and the pair cross twice
guided to third man
tried to run it past point, just misses out
wicket-to-wicket, Imam gets a thick outside edge and goes to slip on the bounce
that's a lovely shot by Imam. Fuller onto the pads, and Imam takes full advantage with a flick of the wrists to midwicket. Pakistan bring up their fifty

ooh, that looked very close. Swinging back into Imam and striking up around the knee roll. The umpire turns the shout down, but we'll have a review. The review shows a clear inside edge, and the decision stands. England lose their review
angled in to him, thick inside edge to fine leg
that was far too short, and Buttler just about prevented it going to the boundary. Well above head height, and Buttler's fingertips saves some runs
baseball stance, baseball shot. Heaved to the onside, not much timing to go with it, though
87mph again. Short and well-directed, or so I thought, but the umpire rules it was a tad too high, and he'll have to do it over.
straighter and Fakhar spoons it past mid-on and the pair run another two. Expensive over. Pakistan going along very nicely
dragged to leg stump, flicked for one
too far down the leg side from Moeen again, and a faint edge sees it race through to fine leg. Slightly sloppy start from the spinner
better line, and Imam only finds the square leg fielder
straight, defended on to the legside
fuller, more flight, worked away to deep midwicket
good length, even a hint of turn. Good over from Moeen after all
starts well, full slightly outside off at 87 mph. Defended to the offside
beautifully driven but a hand from the extra cover fielder prevents any more than just the one run. Wood looking good with his rhythm though, and his pace his high
Fakhar opens up his stance but it's just too close for him to really have a go. Decided to defend it to the offside instead
slower ball, edged away to third man
short and pacy. The 89mph delivery isn't quite as well directed though, and even though Imam ducks, he was never in any discomfort
lovely ball, just beats the outside edge. Good start from Wood.
Moeen gets this full ball to drift in from round the wicket. Fakhar can't put it away with a flick and instead wears it on his pad
another non-turner, slides in and catches the pad as Fakhar plays all around it and falls over
Fakhar stretches out and drives this full ball from outside off to long-off. Smoothly pushed away through the line
dragged shorter and outside off, 88ks, Imad stands up tall and forces the ball down to long-on
Fakhar ventures down the track, Moeen tosses it outside off. Driven through the line once again, down to long-off
fuller and straighter, Imam presses forward and picks it away to wide long-on to close out the over
on a good length and nipping away outside off, offcutter, beats the outside edge
much fuller, another offcutter, which is run down to deep third man
lifter outside off, Fakhar is late onto the hook, this 143kph rocket flies through to the keeper
full and wide, Fakhar loves it there, doesn't he? Flashed away to sweeper cover
chest-high short ball on middle, hooked away to long leg
yorker on off, Fakhar keeps it out
dropped short and outside off, stands up tall and punches down the ground to long-on
skids on middle, backs away and punches down to mid-off
short and breaks away outside off, grip and turn, sliced away in the air but wide of backward point and cover
stretches out and drives up to the covers
slides in with the arm from round the wicket, prodded to the leg side
flighted and outside off, eased down to long-on off the front foot
good length and hunting for off stump, Imam's forward defence intervenes
shorter and angling across off, rides it down to deep third man
back of a length and outside off, possibly another offcutter. Fakhar simply throws his hands at the ball and under-edges it behind to the keeper

Mix-up between the wickets! Morgan throws to the wrong end - effects a direct hit at the non-striker's end. But Imam is in. He didn't want the single. It was Fakhar who wanted a risky single after slapping this full ball to cover. Morgan swooped down on the ball but threw to the wrong end
dug in short, spliced away behind square on the leg side
very full and veering down the leg side for a wide
short on off, fended off

Moeen finds grip and turn! Buttler takes the bails off and thinks he has his man. This was a beauty from Moeen. Drifts in from round the wicket. The flight draws the batsman out of his crease. The ball dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch of the ball. The turn takes it past the bat and Buttler does the rest. Fakhar closes his bat-face and prods at it limply. The TV umpire has been called in to have a look at this. Fakhar can't drag his back foot back in time. Moeen provides England with the breakthrough
shorter and spins in, forced to midwicket off the back foot
shuffles across and works a single to midwicket and gets off the mark
on a length and holds its line outside off, knocked into the leg side off the back foot
skids on outside off, short and outside off, hauled away to long-on
pushed through on and around off, defended
bouncer at 142ks, aimed at the head of Babar, he rocks it out of the way and evades it. Wood runs in hard and hits the pitch harder - that's why Morgan picked him
another lifter outside off, 140kph, rushes Babar into a hook. Spliced in front of mid-on
the short-ball attack continues from Wood, Babar has his eyes locked on the ball before bailing out of the hook. We ll done, Babar
wide of the crease, short at the body (what else?), 144kph, Babar swivels on the back foot and pulls it behind the square on the leg side. Even better from Babar
short at 145kph, the ball hits the bat as opposed to bat hitting ball. Blocked to the covers
back of a length and outside off, sweetly punched through the line to sweeper cover - and that's time for drinks
shorter and slides on outside off, leans back and punches up to the covers does Babar
good length on off, a bit of turn, tapped to the covers
fuller and on the pads, nurdled away through square leg
on a length and breaks in, poked past the covers and Babar hares back for the second
back of a length and outside off, punched on the up to sweeper cover
uses his feet and push-drives this to cover
back of a length and zipping outside off past the outside edge
Babar shuffles across off, gets inside the line, and pulls this short ball in front of square
back of a length and too close to cut, chopped away behind point
pitched up and outside off, punchily driven to sweeper cover. So stylish from Babar...
Imam allows this length ball to come onto him outside off and steers this down to third man
Babar rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and dinks a single down to third man. 100 up for Pakistan
back of a length and outside off, punched down to mid-on
uses his feet and drives this offbreak straight of mid-on
slides on off, tip and run to point
Babar steps out and drops it with soft hands to where an orthodox midwicket might have been. Morgan has a man at straight midwicket
forced down the ground to long-on
Moeen tosses it outside off, full and right in Babar's hitting arc. He gets underneath the length and hoists it over mid-off. One-bounce four
fuller and on middle and leg, off the pad and rolls away to square leg
bouncer outside off, Babar swishes...and misses
chopped down to third man
Imam leans back to this shortish ball outside off and cuts straight to point
chest-high short ball on middle, Imam swivels on the back foot and pulls to deep square leg. 111-1
back of a length and outside off, under-edged behind to the keeper

and gone! Imam danced down the wicket and looked to have struck it sweetly above extra cover. The shot didn't deserve what happened next, with Chris Woakes running the best part of 20 yards to take a diving catch to his left that sends Imam packing
defended back to Moeen
delicate late cut that runs it down to third man. Fielder at 45 had a chase and cuts it off
jabbed away to sweeper cover
Hafeez makes his intentions clear. Waltzes down the wicket and tonks Moeen over mid-off's head
guided through the offside
full, driven to deep cover
short ball, but nowhere near high enough to perturb Babar, who pulls to square leg and turns the strike over
short of a length again, and Hafeez works it down to third man
poor delivery and Stokes gets away with it. Short and wide and slashed away to point, where the man cuts it off
another short ball but Hafeez looked like he was anticipating that. Rocks onto the back foot and whips it behind square, where a diving Jonny Bairstow finds the ball beating him to the short boundary
angled to third man, ends a productive over for Pakistan
starts with a short delivery, guided to deep point
short again and Babar off the back foot hits a clean shot straight to extra cover
flicked elegantly to cow corner
Rashid sees Hafeez coming and drops the ball in short. The batsman takes a run on the onside
gets on the backfoot, cut away to deep extra.
uppish, but well short of midwicket. Good start from Rashid
poked at one wide of off stump. Close to the outside edge
full and straight, driven to mid-on
half-volley and Babar eases it to the offside. Pakistan content with the singles - and even the dots - for now
another poke at one wide of off stump. Some excitement from the field, but it was just bat hitting ground
faster, nippier, straighter. Pakistan sneak a legbye. A muffled lbw appeal, but always going over the stumps
Good one to finish off. Almost squared the batsman up. Babar just about defends it
WOULD YOU BELIEVE THIS? England have dropped a sitter. Hafeez skies one to mid-off and it looked the easiest catch in the world. Roy, however, drops it much to everyone's astonishment
blocked
dragged it down legside
worked through the offside
flicked to fine leg, and the strike changes hands
long hop that Rashid gets away with. Hafeez gives it a smack, but onlt to deep square leg
sliced through the offside, straight to the boundary fielder. Seven from the over
worked off the pads to midwicket
fuller, straighter, but Babar drives sweetly straight to the fielder. he's found fielders off good shots today, has Babar
good fielding from Roy, dives at backward point to save one. Throws the ball away in anger, still seething from that drop
worked to square leg and the pair call for a sharp single
slightly shorter, and Hafeez taps straight down the ground for one
thick outside edge to third man lets Babar keep the strike
Babar charges Rashid again, he's making a habit of this. Beautifully lofted over the onside field, and races above mid-on's head
this one is bigger, it's better! Looked to have been done by the flight, but manages to lift it over cow corner, where it sails into the stands!
defended
blocked
steps out and kills the ball dead again

and the drag-down makes this a very dear over indeed. Babar allowed to get onto the backfoot with all the time in the world, and nail it to the wide midwicket boundary. 14 from this over, and Pakistan have momentum again
Hafeez blocks and tries to run, Babar sensibly tells him he's gone crazy, and that he will not be giving his wicket away in that fashion
Archer's on the money straightaway. Just outside off stump and Hafeez's prod only just beats the outside edge
slower ball, defended to cover
mean from Archer, and is that a bit too harsh by the umpire? Maybe not, on second viewing. Sharp bouncer but well above the batsman's head
worked away to third man deftly
slow again, and uppish to backwar point, but evades the man and the pair run two. That's 50 for Babar. Needs a lot more than that here.
worked off the pads to fine leg
driven down the ground
drift but it's the wrong line. Babar sweeps it away, but fine leg cuts it off at the boundary
defended to the offside
flighted and smashed through extra cover, but that's a remarkable stop from Bairstow. Full length dive on the short boundary ensures two runs are saved
blocked
and Babar keeps the strike with a routine run through the offside
sharp pace, and Babar's attempt to angle it to third man is unsuccessful
slower delivery, and Hafeez smears it with little timing through the legside. Lack of pace means they run two
sharp, that one doesn't get called. 90 mph whizzes past Babar's nostrils, and batsman and bowler exchange a respectful smile
short again, and Babar cuts on the up above backward point, leaving third man to clear up
that was unnecessarily close. tapped and run, and a direct hit means it's touch and go for Babar. He's just made it though, and the third umpire confirms
short and quick again. Hafeez works it down to fine leg. Here's Deiva again
looped up on off, Hafeez stretches out and paddles it away towards fine leg
back of a length and on off, punched down to long-on off the back foot
looped up on off, Hafeez sizes it up, gets underneath this length and serenely lofts it over the bowler's head for six
Rashid aims for the wrong'un but loses his length. Drops short, Hafeez reads it, rocks back and pummels a pull over midwicket. Finesse followed by violence
front-of-the-hand slider, skips away into the gloves of the keeper as Hafeez plays and misses
tossed up outside off, Hafeez sweeps flat and hard to deep midwicket
pitched up and outside off, Hafeez stretches out, drives to sweeper, and rather gingerly runs back for the second
very full on middle and leg, chipped in the air to the left of short midwicket
Babar rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and guides it away fine of deep third man
very full and straight, Babar hangs back, does not connect with a flick, off the pad and rolls away to the leg side
back of a length and outside off, Hafeez opens the face and secures a single to deep third man - time for another drinks break
pushed through outside off, Hafeez drops down to one knee and sweeps flat and hard to deep square leg
starts outside off, turns, bounces, grazes the thigh pad and wanders away to short fine leg
Hafeez flits around in the crease and runs this offbreak from the stumps to short third man
short on middle, backs away and chops it wide of short third man

flighted just a shade outside off, Babar dashes down the track, but does not quite get hold of this. He lifts it with the break, but can't clear the boundary.  Dragged away in the air. Woakes runs in from long-on and snaps up another fine catch diving forward. Moeen's day keeps getting better
glanced off the pads to short fine leg. 200 up for Pakistan with 17 overs left in their innings
bouncer outside off, no shot
wide of the crease, Wood hits a hard length. Angling in and straightening past the outside edge
chest-high short ball on middle, nearly 140ks, Hafeez takes it on with a hook and beats YJB in the deep to his right and finds the square leg boundary. Superbly played, Prof
fuller on off, pushed to mid-off. That was clocked at 149ks - pace like fire
back of a length and outside off, Sarfaraz gets off the mark with a dink to point
full-toss swerves in on off, 146ks, Wood errs in length and Hafeez pounces onto it drilling is straight down the ground past the bowler. Hafeez brings up his fifty in style
down the track and hacked away to deep midwicket
short and breaks in, punched to the left of straight midwicket, where there's another fumble in the field - and it's Roy again. He now has his hands on his mouth
fuller and straighter on middle, tucked into the leg side for a single
floated up outside off, worked to midwicket
Hafeez steps out, Moeen drags his length back, jabbed from outside off to the covers
flighted on off, turns and bounces, top-edged over short fine leg's head
slower offcutter outside off, glided to deep third man
mighty full on off, not quite a yorker, though. Sarfaraz clears his front leg and hauls it away to mid-on
wide of the crease, zipping in at off stump, kept out
back of a length and zipping through outside off at 148ks, Sarfraz has a jab at this but it's too quick for him. Beaten on the outside edge
banged in short at off, 142ks, Sarfraz pulls it away to deep square leg, where Vince the sub fielder fumbles and lets the ball burst through his hands in the outfield
wide of the crease, full and veering down the leg side for a wide as Wood searches for reverse-swing
Sarfraz gets on top of a short ball outside off and bunts a single to cover
down the track and tucked with the break to deep square leg, where there's another misfield. Stokes this time
tip and run to point
Sarfraz searches for some turn but this length ball slides on to beat the outside edge
on a length and bounces outside off, Sarfraz steps back and guides to short third man
dragged down on off, pulled off the back foot to deep midwicket. Sarfaraz went so very deep in the crease
pushed through outside off, Hafeez ventures a sweep but some extra bounce foils his attempt and hits his pad
on a length and outside off, Sarfraz goes deep in the crease and short-arms it over midwicket. Finds the long boundary
short and outside off, kicks up and beats the outside edge near the shoulder of the bat
on the hips, glanced to fine leg
slower ball outside off, guided to the left of point. Roy throws himself to his left and makes a smart stop this time
yet another slower ball outside off, Hafeez jumps across off and laps this away to fine leg
lifter on middle, flies over the head of the batsman into the gloves of the keeper, wide called

dug in short and outside off, Sarfraz splices a pull over midwicket. Fine diving save in the outfield from YJB. He runs across to his left from deep midwicket, dives near the boundary, and swats the ball in
overpitched and outside off, Hafeez leans into this slower ball and creams it between the covers and mid-off. So easy on the eye...
this isn't as full as the previous ball, Hafeez drives on the up in the gap at the covers once again. He comes back for the second
on the pads, clipped away to the man at midwicket
Sarfraz backs away and toe-ends a slog only as far as mid-on
slower yorker from Stokes, 112ks, dips at the batsman, jammed out. Interesting variation
short and outside off, smacked away to deep midwicket
Sarfraz backs away and drags this to mid-on
little offcutter, drop and run to point
Sarfraz backs away, the bowler follows him, heaved to deep square leg
Hafeez rides the bounce and guides this to deep third man
Woakes bangs a slower ball on middle, Sarfraz lines up for a massive blow. He reads the offcutter, delays it, and swats it up and over mid-on. Played, Sarfaraz
Sarfaraz backs away again, off-stump yorker, squirted away to the off side
full, Sarfaraz slogs, but no timing and goes to mid-on
slow, full again, and this time Sarfaraz is prepared. Lifts it over mid-on once more after clearing the front leg. Easy boundary
followed the batsman down the leg side. The pair scramble a run
short ball, but the field wasn't quite set for that delivery. Hafeez swivels and pulls it effectively to a vacant square leg
full, but dragged down leg side. A diving stop at fine leg from Archer prevents the over's third boundary
low full toss, and exquisite timing from Hafeez means it nearly goes all the way to the extra cover boundary, Expensive over, and great start to the final ten for Pakistan
full and straight, Sarfaraz mistimes it back to the bowler
low full toss and the batsman squeezes it into the leg side
slow and straight, but this is masterful from Hafeez. Opens the face of the blade to loft it over a packed offside infield. Once that was cleared, it was always going for four
short delivery, Hafeez ducks
extra bounce did Hafeez there. Looked like he was expecting a fuller one, but short and wide beats the batsman
straighter, but Archer sticks with the short length, Hafeez pulls it to square leg for one
slightly legsidish, but chipped from Hafeez. What a chip, though! Excellent timing, right off the middle of the bat. No power whatsoever but struck it so cleanly it goes over the short boundary.
fuller, and Hafeez picks it up brilliantly once again. The man at deep cover, however, lay in wait
thick edge, and Sarfaraz promptly gives the strike back to Hafeez

gorgeously struck but it's straight to Chris Woakes at long-off! England were desperate for that wicket. Well hit, but failed to manoeuvre the bat face effectively, and as a consequence it goes straight to the man in that catching position, and Pkaistan lose their fourth
full and straight, clatters into Sarfaraz's pads. Loud appeal, but the umpire isn't interested. Perhaps an inside edge
Short and wide, and Sarfaraz attempts to help it on its way, but beaten by the bounce
Asif's first ball flicked to the onside. A suicidal two, and a direct hit would have had Sarfaraz packing
too short, and the umpire calls it a wide, much to Archer's anguish
attempted hoick, an outside edge means it goes to third man instead
guided to the right of third man, and it's a comfortable two
straight to mid-off. The off side infield is so packed it's always tempting to try and go over the top into vacant green grass
that one was exceptionally slow. Asif had time for a cuppa before he got ready to loft it over cover all the way for six.
terrific response from the bowler. 90mph bouncer, and this one is especially well directed. Asif scrambles to get out of the way
slog, no timing, just falls short of a diving mid-on
slower ball, Asif fails to connect as it dribbles through to Buttler
lofted over mid-off and excellent running. Asif takes advantage of a misfield by Woakes at long-off and allows Asif to come back on strike
short ball, Asif's swing was in no way designed to connect with it.
thumped down the ground and a diving Stokes cuts it off at long-on. Not before Pakistan scamper another two
clever ball. Sarfaraz made room and Wood goes wide of off stump. Excellent over, just five of it
full, slashed to long-on
good ball, yorker length. Asif turns it around to fine leg
short ball is too quick for the Pakistan captain, who top edges it into no-man's land. They come back for two, and this brings up Pakistan's 300
another mishit shot pays off. No timing means it doesn't carry to long-on, and the batsmen scuttle another couple. England keeping the boundaries at bay, though.
smart thinking from Sarfaraz. Picked up what the bowler was trying to do, and only had to clear mid-off

oh, dear, what's happening to England?!! They're in a bit of disarray in the field. Sarfaraz sliced the ball to point, who threw it at the stumps without a man backing up in the same post code. It goes all the way to the boundary!

and that spells the end of Asif. Cleared his front leg and smeared it to deep cover. It went straight to Bairstow, who lets out a growl of part-joy, part frustration. He'll have to knock off these runs, you know.
full and quick, Shoaib Malik off the mark with a glance to square leg
looking to get it either side of the man at 45, Straight to him, though
and again. Adil Rashid at 45 is earning his dues right now. Another scampered single
thumped down the ground again. No timing, as has been the case too often. Goes on the bounce to long-on
short, Shoaib tucks it into a little nook into the onside and another two is scurried
sharp running again by Pakistan. Shoaib takes on the long-on fielder and beat him
Woakes gets his man at last! Slower bouncer that Sarfaraz unwittingly scoops into the air. Woakes runs the length of the pitch and then some to take a very good catch, and Pakistan are six down
slower ball, well wide down the leg side
slower ball again, and Shoaib Malik knocks it into the onside to give the new man his first ball
dragged his line down legside again. Easiest boundary Wahab will pick up. Got a fine touch on it to take it racing away
and that was all she wrote for Wahab! Wild swing, but the ball skied and point gets underneath it. No fireworks from Wahab today
nudged into the onside
spooned to long-on, and the pair rush through for two. Hasan needed the dive to make sure he completed it
excellent length. The yorker locks Hasan up, and he can but turn the strike over
wide, and Shoaib Malik swishes at it with no luck
another slower ball, but Shoaib manages to guide this one to third man
short and wide. Hasan swings like a rusty gate, to little effect

and the final ball of the over ruins what's been a great one for England. Muscled over long-off and absolutely sails over the boundary. It's a short ground, but hard to explain how well that was struck. It was bludgeoned!
edged into the air, and while it swirled around interminably, Morgan was the man getting underneath it. Took a difficult catch while making it look very simple
mean. Sharp bounce tonks the batsman on the helmet. Seems to be okay though
unlucky for Wood. Shadab cleared his front leg in an attempt to go to cow corner. Instead found the top edge looping over Buttler's head to an equally desirable outcome
driven to long-on, and a poor throw by Jason Roy allows the batsman an overthrow
brilliant yorker, resulting in a precious dot ball. Can Pak get to 350?
not quite 350, but very impressive nonetheless. Smashed to long-on where a diving Roy fails to get a hand on it to prevent the boundary.
the new ball skids on middle, plopped in the air to the right of the bowler
fractionally short and outside off, Roy slinks back and cracks it hard past point for four. Boom
dirty long-hop from Shadab. He has already lost his length and head. Roy skips back again and hammers a pull to the midwicket fence
back of a length and outside off, Roy goes on the back foot, stabbing the ball to the covers
another shorter legbreak, which is punched to the covers off the back foot

an appeal for lbw. Ambitious appeal from Shadab. Back of a length and skids off the pitch, Shadab hit the pad first before Roy got some bat onto the ball, but the impact was surely outside the line of off and that's rounds off the first over
cracker first up from Amir. Good length, jags back in so very late after starting outside off. Slices YJB into half, beating the inside edge. This is vintage Amir
really full on middle and leg, no movement this time, worked to midwicket
shorter and angling across off, he gets on top of it and forces to cover
fuller than a good length and running away outside off, no shot
short and skids away outside off, another back-foot punch that can't beat cover
much fuller and much wider outside off. Bairstow reaches out for the ball and smears it away in the air. Imam dives across from point, but the ball fizzes away to the fence

Shadab pins Roy in front. The finger goes up, but Roy opts to challenge the on-field out decision. This looks pretty plumb, though. Pushed through on middle, Roy stretches out for a sweep, but this is too full for the shot. Has Roy snicked it? Nah, no bat involved and the UltraEdge confirms it. The tracker returns three reds and Roy has to go. It would have crashed into off stump. Tahir had got Bairstow early in the WC opener. Shadab now gets Roy. The departing batsman, however, isn't particularly happy. He has a word with umpire Erasmus before trudging off. Legspin with the new ball is England's Achilles heel
darted short and outside off, slashed to point
googly, short, punched with the spin to deep midwicket
legbreak outside off, defended off the front foot
slides in on off, full, worked away to square leg
shorter legbreak outside off, flat, goes on the back foot and punches it away to the left of Hafeez at backward point
back of a length and pushed down the leg side for a wide
on a length and angling across off, no movement in the air or off the seam, check-driven to mid-off
picked off the pads to Hasan at long leg
banged in short and outside off, punched to mid-off off the back foot
Amir ventures a slower ball, darts back in, prodded onto the pitch for a single. It was the offcutter from Amir
back of a length and angling across off, punched to the covers off the back foot
short and angling across off, but too close to off for a cut, Root nearly chops on
slides on with the arm outside off, YJB lets it go
delicious legbreak from Shadab. Good length, drifts into Bairstow, tricks him into playing for the drift, but then viciously breaks past the outside edge
pushed through on off, defended off the front foot
what a riposte from YJB! Shadab tosses it outside off, too full. Bairstow flexes his muscles and launches it over the bowler's head. Bam
flat and darted just a shade outside off, stabbed to mid-on
Shadab dangles a legbreak outside off, YJB covers his off stump and shoulders arms
fiery bouncer, 138ks, zipping away outside off, top ball from Amir. Well negotiated by Root. He sways his head inside the line and lets it go

short and swerves back in from outside off, Root aims a punch through cover, but an inside edge trickles down to fine leg. <s>Hasan tumbles near the fence and saves a double for his team</s> The TV umpire reckons Hasan's foot was touching the rope

edged and dropped by Babar to his left at slip! Shortish and angling across off, Root has a slash at it, Babar dives across, but the ball bursts out to the dismay of Pakistan fans. It flew to the slip fielder - another drop off Amir
back of a length and outside off, swatted away like a fly to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, punched to the covers
nudged into the gap at midwicket for a single
back of a length on middle, jabbed back to the bowler
shortish and outside off, slapped away to Hafeez at point
YJB eyes up the leg side and pops a leading edge to the left of the bowler
you can't bowl on the hips with fine leg inside the circle. Swatted away fine of short fine leg
back of a length and slanting away outside off, Bairstow aims to spank it through the covers. Instead, he inside-edges it past the leg stump to the left of the keeper
back of a length and angling across off, defended to cover
slower cutter outside off, stabbed back to Amir off the front foot
short and outside off, Root punches it handsomely to backward point's right for four
too full and straight, clipped into the vacant spaces at midwicket
short and angling across off, punched to backward point off the back foot
shortish and angling across off, chopped to deep third man for one
full on off, Root bunts the ball to point
dug in short and outside off, pulled away through midwicket. Imam slides in the deep to stop the ball
short and skids onto catch the thigh pad, beating YJB's pull. It was surely bouncing over and probably pitched outside leg too
full and wide outside off, Bairstow reaches out for the ball and scythes it away over point
banged in short and bursts through to the keeper. The batsman stabs at it... but is beaten by extra bounce
short and outside off, punched off the back foot to mid-off

Wahab has Bairstow nicking off. Wahab runs in hard and hits the pitch harder. Back of a length, kicking and screaming away outside off at 140ks. Bairstow spars it, probably aiming third man, but can only guide it into the gloves of the keeper. Wahab is pumped
back of a length and fizzes away outside off, Root slashes and does not make contact as the ball bounces over the bat
short and outside off, gets on top of it and punches through the covers
slower ball outside off? Stops on Morgan, check-driven to mid-off
short and outside off, guided to extra-cover off the front foot
overpitched on middle, driven to mid-on off the front foot
back of a length and hoops back in, inside-edged away through square leg
pitched on a length, pace is 87mph. Morgan steers to cover and gets off strike
short, and Root knocks it down to third man
short again. Wahab is really cranking up the pace here. Morgan wisely decided to keep out of its way
length ball, defended back to the bowler
pitched short again, Wahab seems to have settled on that length. Morgan taps and runs. Sharp cricket by the batsmen
driven on the up, not quite in control of the shot, and third man cuts it off. Another tight over comes to an end
bowls length first up, Root steers it down to third man
short, defended to mid-on
uppishly played to mid-on, but ends up bouncing well short of the man there
short and into the body - this is good bowling from Hasan. Morgan gets off strike, but the pressure continues to build
short, tucked away into the on-side
short, this has gone straight up. No, it goes above the keeper's head and sails to the boundary on a couple of bounces. Streaky for England, but they will not care
flight to start with, and Root cautiously prods it back
that's a long hop, and Root effortlessly steers it to a mysteriously vacant gap at square leg. That's an easy putaway, one Pakistan don't want to be giving
worked away to midwicket
flight pushes Morgan back into his crease, producing a defensive shot
plays with the turn to mid-off. This is a decent start by Hafeez, one notable exception
whipped to midwicket, and England get seven off the over
played to the mid-on fielder
width, but Root mistimes it to the point fielder, no chance of a run

classy shot from Root. That wasn't a very bad delivery, short and angled into the batsman. Root rocks back, and cuts it from just underneath his eyes. beats backward point and a rather square third man. Threading the needle
blocked
overpitched, hint of tail into the batsman. Flicked to the midwicket fielder
full toss, and Hasan Ali gets away with that. Root's glance only finds the square leg fielder.
flighted, and Root drives to long-on and strike changes hands
defended into the offside
held its line, and Morgan missed out on the opportunity to put it either side of the point fielder for a boundary
struck to mid-on and alert fielding prevents a run
that's castled Morgan! it didn't turn, but was bowled within the line of the stumps and too close to cut. The England captain attempted it anyway, only to see his stumps knocked back.
blocked to short extra cover, and that ends a successful over for Pakistan, who really must be beginning to believe now
eases it away to third man effortlessly. His presence now looks essential to England's chances
strays too far down the leg side, allowing Stokes to get off the mark with a whip off his pads
good length, not allowing Stokes any room
runs it down behind square
well-directed bouncer, 86mph. Root thought about helping i on its way, but decided to duck after all
another short ball, this time the batsman swivels and collects a single to square leg
flicked away to the on-side
flatter, slightly shorter, and allows Stokes to get onto the back foot and help it to long-on
good delivery, Root wasn't sure about his footwork for a moment. In the end, struck to the man at 45
driven to long-on
flighted and Stokes keeps that same fielder busy as the two take another single
Root keeps the strike. The pair are content to take singles off the spinner at the moment
short, much too short this time. Takes off the pitch and sails over Root's head, leading to the umpire stirring into action
and Root's elegance on full display once more. Short delivery, and Root cuts it past backward point again, leaving third man no chance
big appeal. The ball tailed into Root and struck him low on the front pad. Pakistan think hard about the review, but opt against it. Might just have been a little nick from the bat
thick inside edge to fine leg allows England to come back for two
angling in to Root, who defends this one.
backfoot punch to deep cover. Hasan is getting some inward movement now

ahhh, that's a shot to make you purr with satisfaction. Straight drive from Stokes, cuts mid-off and mid-on in half and rolls down to the boundary, Perhaps the shot of the innings so far. Stokes is off and running properly
and Hafeez driven down to long-on again
overpitched. A crowd catch at midwicket, but nothing more than that
defended to the offside
straight back to the bowler
Stokes uses his feet this time and guides the ball to mid-off
whipped to fine leg and Root reaches 50. What else is new? Hasn't even looked like he was trying, and here he is.
comes from around the wicket. Root defends to mid-on
reverse sweep to no avail. Ball makes contact with his gloves instead and dies on impact
sharp fielding at midwicket prevents the single
this time, Root gets it past that man to long-on
misfield by Shoaib Malik allows another single
knocked down to square leg, and Root keeps the strike. Deiva's back
fractionally short and spins in on off, Root goes on the back foot and pulls to deep square leg
mighty full on leg stump, squeezed down to long-on for one
on a length and on middle, this non-turner is swept away to deep square leg
short and wide, swished away but only as far as backward point
pushed through on off, Stokes dashes down the track and belts it to cover
dropped short and wide outside off, rocks back and smears it to the same fielder. Shadab fumbles this time
full and straight, Stokes mis-hits a reverse-sweep to short third man

Pakistan's offspinners are making deep inroads into England's middle order. Another England batsman dismissed going for a cut when the shot isn't quite on. Pushed through outside off, not much turn, not short enough for the cut. Stokes still throws his hands at it and nicks it behind to Sarfaraz. Win probability for England just dropped from 24.61 to 15.78 percent
back of a length and flat on off from round the wicket, defended to the leg side off the back foot
full and straight, knocked into the leg side again
fuller and on off, driven to the left of straight midwicket, where Shadab makes an apathetic save
back of a length and slides on middle, swept away to deep square
back of a length on off, no turn, whipped away to midwicket
dragged down outside off, dirty ball from Hafeez. Root duly puts it away to the midwicket boundary with a pull
short on middle, Root half-sweeps and half-pulls to deep square leg
skids on outside off, slapped away to the left of sweeper cover
on the pads, glanced away behind square on the leg side
tossed on middle, driven to straight midwicket
slides across off, but too full, Buttler lines it up and smites it in the air over mid-off
shorter and angling across off, punched off the back foot to cover
full and running across off, patted to point
stabbed off the inside half of the bat to straight midwicket
back of a length and angling across off, punched to the covers off the back foot
on the pads, clipped away behind square
turning offbreak from Hafeez, short as Buttler uses his feet and takes it on his thigh
tucked away with the break to deep square leg
full and on off, whipped away to deep midwicket
dragged down on middle, there goes the #UniverseJos. He rocks back and clouts it  over midwicket
short and flat outside off, punched down to wide long-off
Root comes down, nay races down the track, takes a length ball from outside off and plants it into the stands beyond long-on. Bang
chest-high short ball on middle, pulled away to deep square leg
short and on off, fended off
short at the body again, Root pulls it away towards deep square leg
banged in short on middle, hooked to deep square once again
short again, hooked again, deep square mops up again
142ks back-of-a-length ball on middle from Wahab, but Buttler doesn't care. He jumps across off and scoops it away - like only he can - over the keeper's head
tossed up outside off, Root stretches out and eases it to sweeper cover
pitched up and spins away outside off, nailed away to the left of wide long-off. Driven exquisitely with the turn by Buttler
another legbreak, driven out to sweeper cover
drifts in and spins away, Root defends off the front foot
full-toss outside off, stretches out and slog-sweeps to deep square
short and outside off, punched off the back foot through the covers
short on middle and leg, fended away to the leg side
short and speared away outside off, rushes Buttler for pace and bounce. Diffused off the back foot
full and angling across off, swished to cover
back of a length and skipping away outside off, Root jabs away from the body and edges it through vacant slips for four
Wahab keeps pushing Root back with the short stuff, stabbed to point
run away wide of backward point to deep third man
slower legbreak outside off, inside-edged back to the bowler
flat and spins away outside off, goes on the back foot and punches sweetly through the covers
Shadab pulls his length back outside off, forced through the off side once again
really full on middle, whisked down to long-on off the front foot

big appeal for lbw, Shadab pins the pad, not given. Pakistan go for a review. This is surely bouncing over the stumps. Buttler was hit above the knee-roll. Looks like a googly, turns and bounces. Bounces too much to threaten the stumps. Going over
short and outside off, flat-batted away to sweeper cover
edged and flies away to the right of the diving Sarfaraz. On a length and angling across off, Buttler chases a big drive and edges it to third man for four. Nobody in the cordon yet
short and outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
shuffles across off and glances it to fine leg
back of a length and outside off, punched behind point

very full and wide outside off, near yorker, Buttler jams it out and edges it. There's a slip in place now, but it does not carry to him. Babar gets a hand to it, but it trickles away between slip and the keeper
banged in short on off, rolls his wrists and hooks to deep square
driven through the covers
bit of turn, and Root helps it to the man at 45 and the pair steal a single
backfoot drive, easy single to deep extra again
short, and Root gets onto the back foot and cuts away. The boundary rider has a chase, and the pair come back for two
swept in front of square, where the fielder awaits that very shot, and cuts it off

oooh, what a moment that was! Short from Shadab, poor delivery in truth, and Buttler goes back and pulls it to deep midwicket. The fielder leaps despairingly, but finds the ball agonisingly out of his reach. That's 50 for Buttler
tails back in to Root, who dabs it away
driven to mid-off
he could have dragged that on. Hasan getting that movement working again, and Root's edge bounces menacingly close to the stumps
slower ball, defended to point. this is a good, tight over from Hasan thus far
whipped to mid-on and the pair scuttle through
that was uppish. Hit on the splice of the blade, and loops up, but luckily for England, there wasn't a short cover in position
Buttler looking to run it past short third man, but goes straight to him
chipped to long-on. Can Shadab follow up Hasan's tight over with one of his own?
eased to extra cover. Pakistan appear to be quite happy conceding these singles
straight to point. The squeeze is getting a little tighter
short and wide, Buttler missed out there. Just a single
flighted, and Root attempts to hammer it through the covers. No timing and just a run. Another great over for Pakistan
straight to the fielder
slower delivery, flicked to fine leg. Buttler thinks about two but the fielder ensures it's never on
on a length, and catches Root high on the bat. Run rate slowly creeping up to 8.75
driven off the back foot to deep cover point. Four singles and a dot off the over. Can Hasan Ali finish just as well?
that was lobbed into the air, a backfoot upper cut that wasn't too far from third man, who chases and catches it on the bounce. No wicket, but another tight over from Pakistan.
good ball first up. Slower delivery, does Buttler with the extra bounce. Pakistan need a wicket now, or Buttler can meet just about any asking rate
glorious shot from Buttler. It was a decent delivery, tight onto the stumps and little room, but Buttler carves it though the point/cover point gap
And now he cuts loose. Smashed over mid-off and that brings up the century partnership between the two. All the pressure off the last few overs lifts like hot air
defended to the offside
another well-timed shot, but not quite forceful enough to evade mid-off completely. 9 off the over with one to go.
quick single. Good over for England, 10 off it.
Tailing in from Hasan again, and England take another single
good ball, right in the block hole, dipping into the batsman's feet. Buttler still finds a way to get it away to long on
good-looking shot to mid-on for one. Pakistan not really doing too much to stop the singles at the moment. Can they do anything?
flicked off the pads to midwicket, and good fielding at the boundary ensures England only add two to their tally
slower ball, hits the batsman on the pad. Stifled appeal, but Buttler was a long way down
and a loose delivery that Pakistan pay for. Bouncer down the legside and all Root has to do is help it down to the fine leg boundary. Moves to 97 now
slapped away to extra cover, and puts Root on strike. Will he get his hundred this over?
good length, kept slightly low, and Root blocks
another backfoot punch, and Root moves to within two runs of his hundred
smacked down to long-off to put Root back on strike
lovely cover drive, but Pakistan have a fielder out in the deep. One away, the Yorkshireman
sloppy work in the infield, and Buttler gets to keep the strike. Better over, but England beginning to take control now
Buttler beaten by the bounce and pace. Kept low, but not low enough to convince the umpire to give Buttler out lbw
and there's his hundred! The first hundred of the 2019 World Cup. A dab to the offside brings up his 15th, and he could be well on the way to sealing a famous win for England today
length ball, helped to midwicket
stylish shot to celebrate his century. Off the back foot, and caressed to backward point. Bat face opened at the last moment and placed to perfection.
stroked to cover again, but this time closer to the fielder
short and quick, and while Buttler gets no timing on it, England are able to scamper back for two. Nine from the over
spin for Shadab, sliced to backward point on the bounce
scythed to the man at 45 this time. No runs off the first two
. Root's sweep takes the top edge and it goes over the keeper's head. Streaky runs, but runs nonetheless
smart cut, but again to backward point

and there's the wicket!. What a way for this to end. Shadab threw in the quicker bowl, and in his eagerness to play his favourite shot - the dab to third man - Root finds himself late on the shot. It scoops up to the man stationed there, and Pakistan FINALLY make a breakthrough.
good start.Tight line, spinning in. Moeen wisely blocks
starts off with a loose delivery well down legside
short of a length, and flicked off the hips to give Wahab a crack at Moeen
starts off full to Moeen, who times it neatly to the offside and gets himself down the other end

that beats extra cover, but only just. It's the timing that makes the shot. Initially looked uppish, but lands well short of the fielder and wide enough to his left to ensure he doesn't have a chance. Vital boundary for England
flicked off his pads to get himself down the other end. Good over for England this, so far.
short to Moeen, who tucks it into a cranny on the legside and takes a single. This is smart cricket from the pair; they know they've got the boundary and can just milk Wahab this over now
driven to mid-off for one. 10 off the over, and England need 92 off the last ten. To take you through it, here's Deiva.
flighted legbreak, spins away outside off, driven fluently through the covers off the front foot

Sarfaraz, what have you done? Dropped. Shadab slips in a googly, starts on middle, and breaks away sharply. Moeen leaves his crease, closes the bat-face, pokes limply, falls over and edges it behind, but Sarfaraz isn't quick enough to close his gloves around it. Big deflection. Big chance missed
chipped in the air but wide of the man at short midwicket
fuller and outside off, Buttler hits it to sweeper cover
another googly from Shadab, Mooen prods it to short third man
back of a length on middle and leg, whipped behind square on the leg side
short at the body, hops and flaps to midwicket. They hare back for the second
might full and outside off, slapped through the covers
slower ball outside off, punched to covers
full-toss on leg stump, picked away to fine leg
tossed outside off, breaks away, Buttler stretches out and drives with the turn through the gaps. He comes back for the second. Smart cricket from Buttler
pushed through outside off, driven to long-off off the front foot
slider outside off, Moeen chops it away to Amir at short third man
flighted on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
shorter legbreak, forced to deep cover off the back foot
fuller on middle and leg, Moeen nudges a single in front of square on the leg side
full on middle, Moeen hangs back and cracks it to cover. A fumble from Shadab gives up a single
short and outside off, possibly an offutter from Hasan. Buttler does not read the variation. He throws his bat at the ball and inside-edges it to fine leg
back of a length and outside off, Buttler gets on top of the bounce and punches up to the covers

pretty full and outside off, Moeen isn't eager to press forward. He hangs back instead and scoops it away in the air between mid-off and cover. Wahab chases the ball hard, slides near the boundary, and hauls it back in
short on middle and leg, tapped away to wide long-on. Tapped gently enough so that they can come back for the second
slower ball outside off, pushed away to the left of short cover. Buttler moves onto 99
short of a length and slanting away outside off, Buttler has a flash... and misses

Hundred for Jos the boss. He brings up the landmark off 75 balls. This was pitched up and wide outside off, Buttler reaches out for the ball and shovels it away with the bottom hand in the air to the left of mid-off. This is England's fastest World Cup hundred. Top innings from a top batsman. Will it turn out to be a match-winning knock?

Amir fools Buttler with an offcutter and wheels away. Pakistan are still in this. Amir ensures they're still in this. This is the variation - the offcutter that is short and swerves away outside off. The extra bounce means Buttler can't line this up. He slashes and top-edges it into the lap of short third man
back of a length and angling across off, seam-up, punched to sweeper
mighty full on middle and leg, Moeen drills the ball away to long-on
slower offcutter from Amir, but this is fuller, knocked to Zaman at mid-off
short and outside off, backs away and splices to point
sharp bouncer from Hasan, too quick for Moeen, gloved in the air, but does not carry to Sarfaraz behind the stumps
back of a length on middle and leg, punched down to long-on
yes it's the variation, Moeen does not pick it. He swings for the hills... and misses it altogether
another slower ball, on a length and cuts back in, Moeen can't pick this either. Swipes and does not connect
on a length and outside off, Moeen goes for a loft but can only flap it over the bowler's head. Moeen continues to struggle for timing
back of a length on middle, Woakes steps away, gives himself some room, and jabs it away to wide long-off, wide enough for him to come back for the second
Shadab and Imam circle around the swirling ball in the outfield near deep cover. But the ball falls into no-man's land. Another cutter from Amir, Woakes skies it and gets away with it
short and angling across off, Woakes simply throws his bat at it and edges it away fine of short third man for four
full and wide - inside the tramline - Woakes reaches out for the ball but can't touch it. Tight call, but not a wide
wide yorker, off-side wide, well past the tramline
slower cutter, good length and swerving away outside off, Woakes swishes... and misses. That's a tight call again, just past the tramline. Another off-side wide
back of a length, pitches outside leg, skids off the pitch, pings the thigh pad and rolls away to cover. Leg bye

slower short ball on middle, Moeen lines it up and swats a pull away to the left of deep square leg. Imam dives in vain and watches it whistle away to the boundary. First boundary for Moeen. Has he found his groove at the right time for England? Sarfraz isn't pleased with Amir's length
Asif Ali runs in from sweeper cover... but drops it. It was a tough chance, though. Full and wide outside off, skied in the air. Asif was late to take off, he still got to the ball, but spilled it
pinpoint yorker on middle, Wahab's sort of coming from behind the umpire, nails the blockhole, jammed out
Wahab errs too full and outside off, he can't get the yorker right this time. Woakes gives himself swinging room and lifts it inside-out over long-off. Woakes loving going inside-out
short and wide, another slower ball, delays his swat and sends the ball to sweeper cover

Wahab takes down Moeen with a slower bouncer. Sarfaraz and Wahab in the middle of an animated chat. Good variation from Wahab and he bangs it in outside off. Moeen searches for the ramp down to third man, but can only pop a catch to backward point, where Fakhar Zaman makes no mistake

What a double-blow from Wahab. Welcome back, Wahab! Coach Arthur enjoyed that. He claps away in glee. Wahab roars and pumps his fist. These emotions tell you the story. That's how you prove your coach wrong. After the slower one, Wahab hits 87mph and finds extra bounce. Banged in short and zipping away, Woakes flashes and the edge flies through to the keeper. Sarfaraz takes the ball over his head
full and wide outside off, smeared away to sweeper cover
Rashid jumps a long way across off, the bowler follows him, Rashid still can't touch it. Not a wide either
wide yorker, scooped away to deep point. Excellent lengths from Pakistan bowlers in the past few overs

Wahab in the thick of things again, this time he holds onto a pressure catch at deep third man. He runs in from the outfield and bends forward to pouch it. Archer swings at this - quite possibly a slower ball - and skies it to Wahab
full and wide, slashed away to deep third man
back of a length and outside off, this cutter is stabbed away to the right of Amir
the batsman gives himself from room, Wahab comes in from behind the umpire. Wide yorker, beaten
Wood backs away outside leg and smites this full-toss over the covers
Wood gives himself more room, Wahab spears it full and wide, 142ks, Wood can't connect
very full and angling in at off, 141ks, jabbed to the covers
slower bouncer on middle, 118ks, Rashid looks away, takes his eyes off the ball, flapped to the leg side
Wahab bowls off just two steps, short and on the hips, tickled away fine of short fine leg, but PAKISTAN WIN
